neutral_act0_intro_apartment.text: Your apartment walls tremble as sirens fade into rain. Someone hammers on your door and whispers your name: Alex, the neighbor who always fixes the fuse box.

choices.text: Check the peephole before touching the locks

effects.pushEvent: You study Alex's panic through the fisheye glass.

choices.text: Drag the dresser toward the door just in case

effects.pushEvent: Wood scrapes the tile as you brace the entryway.

choices.text: Call out to Alex through the door

effects.pushEvent: Alex answers with breathless relief.

choices.text: Ignore the knocking and secure your supplies

effects.pushEvent: The knocking eventually stops. Silence follows.

neutral_act0_contact_alex.text: Alex shakes, soaked in alley rain. Their brother turned downstairs, the infection spreading door to door. Blood stains their jacket. They beg you to choose: hide together, share supplies, or keep distance.

choices.text: Undo the locks and pull Alex inside

effects.pushEvent: You haul Alex over the threshold and slam the deadbolt.

choices.text: Pass gauze and water through the chain

effects.pushEvent: You slide supplies through the gap while the hallway wails.

choices.text: Keep the chain tight and gather every detail

effects.pushEvent: You map the outbreak street by street as Alex talks.

choices.text: Close the door and let Alex fend for themselves

effects.pushEvent: You hear Alex's screams fade as you bolt the door.

alex_path_saved_warm.text: Alex collapses on your floor, sobbing with relief. They grip your hands. 'Thank you. Thank you. I thought I was dead.' Their brother's blood is still wet on their clothes. What happens next will define everything.

choices.text: Hold Alex and let them cry it out

effects.pushEvent: Alex clings to you like a lifeline. You promise to keep them safe.

choices.text: Immediately treat their wounds

effects.pushEvent: You work efficiently, cleaning wounds while Alex steadies.

choices.text: Demand information about what's happening outside

effects.pushEvent: Alex shares everything through shaking breaths.

alex_becomes_close_friend.text: Over the next hour, Alex opens up. They tell you about their brother, their fears, their hopes. You share your own story. A bond forms in the darkness—something real in a dying world.

choices.text: Share your last good meal together

effects.pushEvent: Alex shows you a photo of their family. You promise to find them together.

choices.text: Plan your survival strategy as a team

effects.pushEvent: You map escape routes together, equals in this fight.

alex_friendship_solidified.text: Alex looks at you with something beyond gratitude—trust. Real trust. They hand you their brother's lucky knife. 'He'd want you to have this. We're in this together now, right?' The choice is yours.

choices.text: Accept the knife and promise to watch their back

effects.pushEvent: You and Alex make a pact. No one gets left behind.

choices.text: Gently refuse—you work better alone

effects.pushEvent: Alex nods, understanding but hurt. The distance grows.

alex_becomes_ally.text: You wrap Alex's wounds with clinical efficiency. They watch you work, seeing competence. 'You know what you're doing,' they say. 'I can follow your lead.' An alliance forms.

choices.text: Good. We'll need to work together to survive.

effects.pushEvent: Alex nods, ready to follow your commands.

choices.text: We help each other, but we're not friends

effects.pushEvent: Alex understands. This is business, not sentiment.

alex_becomes_useful.text: Alex's voice cracks as they describe the infection spreading, the militia checkpoints, the burning buildings. You catalog everything. They're a resource—intel, skills, leverage. Nothing more.

choices.text: Extract every detail, then decide their usefulness

effects.pushEvent: Alex realizes you're using them. They say nothing.

alex_path_saved_distant.text: Alex takes the supplies through the crack, eyes grateful but wary. 'I won't forget this,' they say. Then they turn and disappear into the smoke. The building groans. You may see them again.

choices.text: Remember where they went—might be useful later

effects.pushEvent: You note which stairwell they took.

choices.text: Let them go and focus on your own survival

effects.pushEvent: Alex vanishes into the dark. Their fate is theirs alone.

alex_path_saved_cold.text: After pumping Alex for information, you finally open the door. They stagger in, realizing you were using them. The hurt in their eyes is visible. But they're alive. And they owe you.

choices.text: Make it clear they owe you for this

effects.pushEvent: Alex nods slowly. They know the debt they carry.

choices.text: Soften slightly—survival makes people harsh

effects.pushEvent: Alex accepts the olive branch. Maybe trust can grow.

alex_path_abandoned.text: The screams stop after thirty seconds. Through the peephole, you see Alex's body dragged into the stairwell by infected hands. Their eyes were still open. Still looking at your door. Waiting for mercy that never came.

choices.text: Wait for the infected to leave, then loot Alex's body

effects.pushEvent: You rifle through Alex's pockets with steady hands.

choices.text: Sit with the guilt and the silence

effects.pushEvent: Their face will haunt your dreams.

choices.text: Rationalize it—they were already infected

effects.pushEvent: You convince yourself it was necessary. Almost believe it.

alex_dead_ruthless.text: Alex's supplies include keys to the basement armory and a radio with encrypted frequencies. Their death purchased your survival. You pocket everything and move on.

choices.text: Use the keys to access the armory

effects.pushEvent: The armory is yours. So are the consequences.

alex_dead_haunted.text: You can't stop seeing Alex's face. The trust. The betrayal. The terror. Every shadow in your apartment looks like them. You need to move, need to act, need to escape the guilt.

choices.text: Channel the guilt into determination—save others

effects.pushEvent: You vow to save who you can. For Alex.

alex_dead_cold.text: You run the numbers: Alex was infected (probably), slowing you down (definitely), emotionally unstable (absolutely). The math checks out. Survival isn't about feelings. You're learning.

choices.text: Embrace the cold logic of survival

effects.pushEvent: Emotion is weakness. You won't make that mistake again.

alex_path_ignored.text: The knocking stopped five minutes ago. You peek through the peephole. The hallway is empty except for drag marks and blood. Alex is gone. You'll never know if they survived. Your supplies are secure. Your conscience is not.

choices.text: Search the hallway for signs of Alex

effects.pushEvent: You find Alex's jacket, torn and bloody. No body.

choices.text: Move on—survival requires focus

effects.pushEvent: You lock the door and don't look back.

alex_ignored_maybe_alive.text: The jacket is warm. The blood is fresh. Alex might still be alive, somewhere in this building. Or they might be turning. Or they might be dead. Schrödinger's neighbor.

choices.text: Search the building for Alex

effects.pushEvent: You descend into the infected hallways, calling their name.

choices.text: Take the jacket for warmth and move on

effects.pushEvent: The jacket still smells like Alex's shampoo.

alex_search_floor_2.text: Floor 2: Doors hang open. Blood trails lead in multiple directions. Infected groan in the darkness. You hear something—breathing? Crying? Or just wind?

choices.text: Investigate the sounds on floor 2

effects.pushEvent: You creep through floor 2, weapon ready.

choices.text: Continue to floor 3

effects.pushEvent: You move deeper into the building.

choices.text: Give up the search and return to your apartment

effects.pushEvent: You tried. That has to be enough.

alex_found_floor_2.text: You find Alex huddled in a closet on floor 2, shaking but alive. They look at you with disbelief. 'You came back for me.' Their voice breaks.

choices.text: Help Alex to safety

effects.pushEvent: You pull Alex to their feet. Redemption is possible.

alex_search_floor_3.text: Floor 3: Doors hang open. Blood trails lead in multiple directions. Infected groan in the darkness. You hear something—breathing? Crying? Or just wind?

choices.text: Investigate the sounds on floor 3

effects.pushEvent: You creep through floor 3, weapon ready.

choices.text: Continue to floor 4

effects.pushEvent: You move deeper into the building.

choices.text: Give up the search and return to your apartment

effects.pushEvent: You tried. That has to be enough.

alex_found_floor_3.text: You find Alex huddled in a closet on floor 3, shaking but alive. They look at you with disbelief. 'You came back for me.' Their voice breaks.

choices.text: Help Alex to safety

effects.pushEvent: You pull Alex to their feet. Redemption is possible.

alex_search_floor_4.text: Floor 4: Doors hang open. Blood trails lead in multiple directions. Infected groan in the darkness. You hear something—breathing? Crying? Or just wind?

choices.text: Investigate the sounds on floor 4

effects.pushEvent: You creep through floor 4, weapon ready.

choices.text: Continue to floor 5

effects.pushEvent: You move deeper into the building.

choices.text: Give up the search and return to your apartment

effects.pushEvent: You tried. That has to be enough.

alex_found_floor_4.text: You find Alex huddled in a closet on floor 4, shaking but alive. They look at you with disbelief. 'You came back for me.' Their voice breaks.

choices.text: Help Alex to safety

effects.pushEvent: You pull Alex to their feet. Redemption is possible.

alex_search_floor_5.text: Top floor. The roof access is blocked. Blood everywhere but no Alex. Either they escaped, turned, or died. You'll never know which.

choices.text: Check the roof access one last time

effects.pushEvent: The roof is empty. Alex is gone.

alex_search_failed.text: You searched every floor. Alex is gone. The guilt of ignoring them initially weighs heavier now. You tried to make it right. It wasn't enough.

choices.text: Accept that you can't save everyone

effects.pushEvent: The lesson burns: hesitation kills.

alex_rescued_redemption.text: You half-carry Alex back to your apartment. They lean on you, weak but alive. 'I thought you didn't care,' they whisper. 'I was wrong.' Second chances are rare in the apocalypse.

choices.text: Promise to protect them from now on

effects.pushEvent: A bond forms from ashes of shame.

neutral_act0_background_select.text: Alex asks what to do next. The answer depends on who you are. Choose the skills you'll lean on when the city falls.

choices.text: \"I'm the medic on this floor. Let me triage.\"

effects.pushEvent: Your medic bag hits the floor ready to open.

choices.text: \"I'm the union muscle. I keep us standing.\"

effects.pushEvent: Metal groans as you pry a locker open for gear.

choices.text: \"I'm the building's network tech. I keep us linked.\"

effects.pushEvent: You boot a battered laptop and reroute the rooftop antenna.

choices.text: \"I'm the one who slips locks and keeps us stocked.\"

effects.pushEvent: Lockpicks clink in your palm; Alex eyes you with wary trust.
